channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Real estate CEO says the luxury industry is all about one thing: a ‘return on ego’

item.title: How Bupa’s CEO Iñaki Ereño woke a sleeping giant—and set a 100,000 strong workforce running toward digital health
item.description: How Bupa’s CEO balances triathlons, technology and the transformation of global health.

item.title: A River Restoration in Oregon Gets Fast Results: The Salmon Swam Right Back

item.title: The Hollywood blueprint holds the key to reshaping organizations in the age of AI
item.description: The Hollywood model of work is a refreshing alternative to the rigid structures of the industrial era.

item.title: ‘Not Very Much Survives a Category 5,’ and the Use of Tear Gas in Chicago
item.description: Plus, the website reshaping live music.

item.title: When Caregiving Makes Women Ill

item.title: Israeli Strikes in Gaza Kill at Least 100, Local Health Officials Say
item.description: Israel said the cease-fire had resumed after what appeared to be the deadliest day since the truce deal was agreed this month.

item.title: A Nazi Tattoo Exposes Democrats’ Greatest Weakness
item.description: Do Democrats know what the working class actually looks like?

item.title: Everyone thinks AI is replacing factory workers, but Amazon’s layoffs show it’s coming for middle management first
item.description: As Amazon slashes 14,000 white-collar roles and the U.S. approaches a million job cuts this year, AI’s first major labor casualty might be emerging.

item.title: Saudi Arabia is now a nation of city-dwellers, and ‘cities don’t lie,’ says urban development leader
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Mercedes Reports a Drop in Profit but Maintains Forecast
item.description: The German carmaker held its outlook steady and said it would buy back more than $2 billion in shares, as sales of its high-end models improved.
